Class BankAccount

  • java.lang.Object
    • BankAccount
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SavingsAccount

    public class BankAccount
extends java.lang.Object
    BankAccount.java - stores balances, allows deposits/withdraws.

    BankAccount can be called by the following:

    • BankAccount b = new BankAccount();
    • BankAccount c = new BankAccount(2342.12);
    • BankAccount d = new BankAccount(2342.12, "Ethan Lee", 2.25, 1234);

    These parameters are explained below.

    Version:
    1.6
    Author:
    ethan.lee

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String accountID
      A misnomer, really - only holds the name of the account holder.
      protected double balance
      Stores the balance for a BankAccount, in a double format.
      protected double BANK_FEE 
      private static java.text.NumberFormat currencyFormat
      Used to printout money values in the correct locale format.
      protected double interest
      Stores the interest for a BankAccount, in a double format.
      protected int MAX_FREE_TRANSACTIONS 
      protected int numTransactions 
      protected int pinNumber
      Stores an integer PIN number for a BankAccount.
      protected boolean transactOn
      Used for authentication, indicates if account is open to transactions or not.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BankAccount()
      ã€€ Constructs a new BankAccount with an empty balance.
      BankAccount(double initial)
      Constructs a BankAccount with only an initial balance.
      BankAccount(double initial, java.lang.String name, double rate, int pin)
      Constructs a new BankAccount with all set parameters.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addInterest(double percentageRate)
      Applies a certain interest rate and adds it to the balance.
      void deductMonthlyCharge()
      Calculates and deducts the monthly charge from the current bank account.
      void deposit(double amount)
      Deposits a certain amount into the current account if logged in.
      boolean doAuth(int challenge)
      Checks PIN authentication.
      double getBalance()
      Returns the balance for an account.
      void send(BankAccount recipient, double amount)
      Sends a certain amount from one account (implicit) to another.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a summary of the account when called via toString(), overrides default Object toString() method.
      void voidAuth()
      Disables transaction sending, essentially logging out.
      void withdraw(double amount)
      Withdraws a certain amount if logged in.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • balance

        protected double balance
        Stores the balance for a BankAccount, in a double format.

      • interest

        protected double interest
        Stores the interest for a BankAccount, in a double format.

      • pinNumber

        protected int pinNumber
        Stores an integer PIN number for a BankAccount. Although it can be called directly by a negative integer, the BankAccount command line interface prevents this. It is generally considered bad practices to have a negative PIN number.

      • transactOn

        protected boolean transactOn
        Used for authentication, indicates if account is open to transactions or not.

      • numTransactions

        protected int numTransactions

      • BANK_FEE

        protected final double BANK_FEE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_FREE_TRANSACTIONS

        protected final int MAX_FREE_TRANSACTIONS
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • currencyFormat

        private static java.text.NumberFormat currencyFormat
        Used to printout money values in the correct locale format.

      • accountID

        public java.lang.String accountID
        A misnomer, really - only holds the name of the account holder. Public scope so that other classes can access this for login.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BankAccount

        public BankAccount()
        ã€€ Constructs a new BankAccount with an empty balance. Name, rate, and PIN are not set and authentication will fail.

        public BankAccount(double initial)
        Constructs a BankAccount with only an initial balance.

           java.lang.String name,

    • Method Detail

      • doAuth

        public boolean doAuth(int challenge)
        Checks PIN authentication.
        Parameters:
        challenge - the attempted PIN

      • voidAuth

        public void voidAuth()
        Disables transaction sending, essentially logging out.

      • deposit

        public void deposit(double amount)
        Deposits a certain amount into the current account if logged in.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to be deposited

      • withdraw

        public void withdraw(double amount)
        Withdraws a certain amount if logged in.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to be withdrawn

      • deductMonthlyCharge

        public void deductMonthlyCharge()
        Calculates and deducts the monthly charge from the current bank account.

      • send

        public void send(BankAccount recipient,
        double amount)
        Sends a certain amount from one account (implicit) to another.
        Parameters:
        recipient - the BankAccount receiving the money
        amount - the amount to be sent

      • addInterest

        public void addInterest(double percentageRate)
        Applies a certain interest rate and adds it to the balance.
        Parameters:
        percentageRate - the rate of interest to be calculated in

      • getBalance

        public double getBalance()
        Returns the balance for an account.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a summary of the account when called via toString(), overrides default Object toString() method.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
